result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mya Angela Hartfield

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mya Angela Hartfield appeared by video.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Mya Angela Hartfield.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requests a scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mya Angela Hartfield appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pre-trial conference held. Defendant MAY qualify for public defender representation. Court instructed the defendant to contact the PD's Office to determine eligibility. Court adjourns the matter for a status of counsel hearing in branch 29.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AEC; JML
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Mya Angela Hartfield appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Mya Angela Hartfield.  Attorney Samuel Tabin appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court reserves defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until defendant's next scheduled court appearance. DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  sibsThis hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
